IV (Notices) NOTICES FROM EUROPEAN UNION INSTITUTIONS AND BODIES EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT 2008-2009 SESSION Sittings of 16 to 19 June 2008 STRASBOURG MINUTES (2008/C 207 E/01) PROCEEDINGS OF THE SITTING IN THE CHAIR: Hans-Gert PÖTTERING President 1. Resumption of the session The sitting opened at 17.00. 2. Statements by the President Referendum in Ireland on the Reform Treaty The President made the following statement: The result of the referendum of 12 June 2008 in Ireland confronts the European Union with one of the most difficult challenges in its history. The Lisbon Reform Treaty, derived from the Constitutional Treaty, which itself was drafted by a Convention meeting in public and comprising members of national parliaments and the European Parliament, allows the European Union more democracy, greater ability to act and greater transparency. It strengthens the European Parliament, gives national parliaments more responsibility in determining the course of European policy, allows citizens of the European Union a power of initiative in relation to the European Institutions, and guarantees local self-government. The Lisbon Treaty is the answer to criticisms which citizens have levelled at the deficits of the European Union. This Treaty brings the European Union closer to its citizens. We must make it abundantly clear 14.8.2008 EN C 207 E/1 Official Journal of the European Union Monday 16 June 2008

that the adoption of the Reform Treaty is an absolute necessity, to enable the European Union to defend its values and interests in the 21st century. Without the reforms which are made possible by the Lisbon Treaty, the accession of further countries to the European Union is hardly conceivable. We call upon the EU Summit on Thursday and Friday in Brussels to take all appropriate steps to make the Reform Treaty a reality. The ratification process must continue without reservation. We call upon the Irish Government, for its part, to submit proposals as to how we can jointly progress beyond this difficult phase in European politics. The European Parliament will devote all its energies and display maximum commitment to overcoming these challenges. We expect the same of the European Commission and of the govern- ments of all European Union Member States. We equally expect the European Parliament to be com- prehensively involved in the work concerned. It remains our goal to see the Lisbon Treaty enter into force before the elections of June 2009 to the European Parliament. Provided that you agree to this, I shall resolutely propound these principles to the European Council on 19 and 20 June in Brussels. Situation in the Middle East The President, at the request of the Conference of Presidents, then made a statement on the findings of the report by the Middle East working group delegation which visited Israel and Palestine from 30 May to 2 June 2008. 3. Approval of the Minutes of the previous sitting The Minutes of the previous sitting were approved. 4. Composition of political groups Marek Aleksander Czarnecki had joined the ALDE Group with effect from 10.06.2008. 5. Parliamentary immunity The Italian authorities had sent the President a request concerning the parliamentary immunity of Massimo D'Alema in the context of a case pending before the district court of Milan relating to incidents that had occurred when he was a Member of the European Parliament. Pursuant to Rule 6(2), the request had been referred to the committee responsible, the JURI Committee. * * * Witold Tomczak had sent the President a request for the defence of his immunity and privileges in the context of a case pending before the district court of Ostrów Wielkopolski. Under Rule 6(3), the request had been referred to the committee responsible, the JURI Committee. 6. 14. Referral to committees Proposal for a Council decision on the CARIFORUM partnership agreement (COM(2008)0156): The Con- ference of Presidents had decided at its meeting of 22.05.2008 to refer the document in question to the INTA Committee as the committee responsible and to the DEVE Committee for an opinion under Rule 47. 15. Change of interinstitutional classification number The Commission had changed the interinstitutional classification number of the proposal for a Council decision in accordance with Article 122(2) of the Treaty on the adoption by Slovakia of the single currency on 1 January 2009 (COM(2008)0249 — C6-0198/2008 — 2008/0095(CNS)) (A6-0231/2008) to 2008/0092(CNS). 16. Request for urgent procedure Council request for the application of urgent procedure (Rule 134) for: Proposal for a Council regulation on the conclusion of the Protocol setting out the fishing opportunities and financial contribution provided for in the Fisheries Partnership Agreement between the European Com- munity and the Islamic Republic of Mauritania for the period 1 August 2008 to 31 July 2012 [COM(2008)0243 — C6-0199/2008 — 2008/0093(CNS)] Reason for request: Concluding this protocol would allow the first payment of the financial contribution to be made before the end of August 2008 and thereby avoid disruption to Member States' fishing activities. Parliament would take a decision on this request at the start of the following day's sitting (Tuesday). 17. Order of business The next item was the order of business. The final draft agenda for the June I and II sittings (PE 408.289/PDOJ) had been distributed and a number of changes had been proposed (Rule 132): Sittings of 16.06.2008 to 19.06.2008 Monday — no changes Tuesday In order to reach agreement with the Council at first reading, the vote on the report by József Szájer (A6-0216/2008) (Item 69 on the final draft agenda) was postponed to a later sitting. Wednesday Request by the IND/DEM Group to change the title of the debate on the preparation of the European Council (Item 44 on the final draft agenda) to ‘ Preparation of the European Council after the Irish referendum ’ . C 207 E/14 EN 14.8.2008 Official Journal of the European Union Monday 16 June 2008

The following spoke: Gerard Batten, on behalf of the IND/DEM Group, who moved the request. Parliament agreed to the request. The title of the Council and Commission statements was amended accordingly. Request by the PSE Group to postpone until the afternoon the Council and Commission statements on the measures to combat the rise in oil prices (Item 74 on the final draft agenda) and to take the item in a joint debate with the oral questions on the crisis in the fisheries sector caused by rising fuel oil prices (Item 81 on the final draft agenda) . The following spoke: Hannes Swoboda, on behalf of the PSE Group, who moved the request, Richard Corbett, Carmen Fraga Estévez, on behalf of the PPE-DE Group, and Francis Wurtz, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, who proposed that the President consult the House first on increasing the speaking time for the debate on the preparation of the European Council and then on the holding of a joint debate on the measures to combat the rise in oil prices and the crisis in the fisheries sector. The President, acceding to this proposal, put the request on extending the debate on the preparation of the European Council after the Irish referendum to the vote. Parliament agreed to the request by electronic vote (122 in favour, 93 against, 1 abstention). The President then put to the vote the request concerning the holding of a joint debate on the measures to combat the rise in oil prices and the crisis in the fisheries sector caused by the rising price in fuel oil. Parliament rejected the request by electronic vote (38 in favour, 152 against, 16 abstentions). Thursday — no changes Sitting of 24.06.2008 — no changes * * * The order of business was thus established. 18. IN THE CHAIR: Edward McMILLAN-SCOTT Vice-President 13. Composition of Parliament The Italian authorities had given notice of the election of Nicola Zingaretti and Giuseppe Bova to offices incompatible with that of a Member of the European Parliament under Article 7(3) of the Act concerning the election of members of the European Parliament by direct universal suffrage. Parliament took note of this and, in accordance with Rule 4(1), established that the seats were vacant with effect from 17.06.2008. * * * The Italian authorities had given notice of the appointment of Rapisardo Antinucci, Domenico Antonio Basile and Maria Grazia Pagano, in place of Nicola Zingaretti, Adriana Poli Bortone and Giuseppe Bova, as Members of the European Parliament with effect from 17.06.2008. Under Rule 3(2), until such time as their credentials had been verified or a ruling had been given on any dispute, and provided that they had previously made a written declaration stating that they did not hold any office incompatible with that of Member of the European Parliament, Rapisardo Antinucci, Domenico Antonio Basile and Maria Grazia Pagano would take their seats in Parliament and on its bodies and would enjoy all the rights attaching thereto. * * * Sorin Frunz ă verde had given notice in writing of his resignation as Member of Parliament, with effect from 05.06.2008. Under Rule 4(1) and (7), Parliament established the vacancy and informed the Member State concerned thereof. 14. MINUTES (2008/C 207 E/03) PROCEEDINGS OF THE SITTING IN THE CHAIR: Rodi KRATSA-TSAGAROPOULOU Vice-President 1. Opening of the sitting The sitting opened at 09.05. 2. Preparation of the European Council following the Irish referendum (debate) Council and Commission statements: Preparation of the European Council following the Irish referendum Janez Lenar č i č (President-in-Office of the Council) and José Manuel Barroso (President of the Commission) made the statements (the President intervened during José Manuel Barroso's speech to call on Members demonstrating in support of the result of the referendum in Ireland to remove the banners they had unfurled in the Chamber). The following spoke: Joseph Daul, on behalf of the PPE-DE Group, Martin Schulz, on behalf of the PSE Group, Graham Watson, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Monica Frassoni, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Brian Crowley, on behalf of the UEN Group, Francis Wurtz, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Nigel Farage, on behalf of the IND/DEM Group, and Ashley Mote, Non-attached Member. 2008-2009 SESSION Sitting of 24 June 2008 BRUSSELS MINUTES (2008/C 207 E/05) PROCEEDINGS OF THE SITTING IN THE CHAIR: Hans-Gert PÖTTERING President 1. Resumption of the session The sitting opened at 09.05. 2. Approval of the Minutes of the previous sitting The Minutes of the previous sitting were approved. 3. Results of the European Council meeting of 19 and 20 June 2008 in Brussels — Slovenian Presidency's term of office (debate) European Council report and Commission statement: Results of the European Council meeting of 19 and 20 June 2008 in Brussels Statement by the Presidency-in-Office of the Council: Slovenian Presidency's term of office Janez Jan š a (President-in-Office of the Council) presented the European Council's report on the results of the European Council meeting on 19 and 20 June in Brussels and, as President-in-Office of the Council, made a statement on the six months of the Slovenian Presidency's term of office. José Manuel Barroso (President of the Commission) also made a statement on the results of the European Council meeting. The following spoke: Hartmut Nassauer, on behalf of the PPE-DE Group, Martin Schulz, on behalf of the PSE Group, Graham Watson, on behalf of the ALDE Group, Monica Frassoni, on behalf of the Verts/ALE Group, Brian Crowley, on behalf of the UEN Group, Francis Wurtz, on behalf of the GUE/NGL Group, Kathy Sinnott, on behalf of the IND/DEM Group, Roger Helmer, Non-attached Member, Philip Bushill- Matthews, Hannes Swoboda, Jelko Kacin, Mario Borghezio, Mary Lou McDonald, Luca Romagnoli, Mihael Brejc, Jo Leinen, Andrew Duff, Jim Allister, Avril Doyle, Andrzej Jan Szejna, Silvana Koch-Mehrin, Philip Claeys, Elmar Brok, Proinsias De Rossa, Romana Jordan Cizelj, Libor Rou č ek, Gay Mitchell, Enrique Barón Crespo and Ljudmila Novak. 14.8.2008 EN C 207 E/279 Official Journal of the European Union Tuesday 24 June 2008

The following spoke under the ‘ catch-the-eye ’ procedure: Carlo Fatuzzo, Csaba Sándor Tabajdi, Reinhard Rack, Gérard Onesta, Genowefa Grabowska, Tunne Kelam, Richard Corbett, Derek Roland Clark and Alojz Peterle. The following spoke: Janez Jan š a and José Manuel Barroso. The debate closed. 4. Composition of Parliament The Italian authorities had given notice of the election of Gian Paolo Gobbo and Francesco Musotto to offices incompatible with those of Members of the European Parliament under Article 7(3) of the Act con- cerning the election of the representatives of the European Parliament by direct universal suffrage. Parliament took note of this and, in accordance with Rule 4(1), established that the seats were vacant with effect from 23 June 2008. The Italian authorities had given notice of the appointment of Paolo Bartolozzi, Erminio Enzo Boso and Innocenzo Leontini, to replace Antonio Tajani, Gian Paolo Gobbo and Francesco Musotto, as Members of the European Parliament with effect from 23 June 2008. Under Rule 3(2), until such time as their credentials had been verified or a ruling had been given on any dispute, and provided that they had previously made a written declaration stating that they did not hold any office incompatible with that of Member of the European Parliament, Paolo Bartolozzi, Erminio Enzo Boso and Innocenzo Leontini would take their seats in Parliament and on its bodies and would enjoy all the rights attaching thereto. 5. Texts of agreements forwarded by the Council The Council had forwarded certified true copies of the following: — Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and its Member States, of the one part, and the Swiss Confederation, of the other, on the free movement of persons, regarding the participa- tion, as contracting parties, of the Republic of Bulgaria and Romania pursuant to their accession to the European Union; — Stabilisation and Association Agreement between the European Communities and their Member States of the one part, and the Republic of Serbia, of the other part 6. Dates of forthcoming sittings The next sittings would be held from 7 July 2008 to 10 July 2008. 7. Adjournment of the session The session of the European Parliament was adjourned. The sitting closed at 11.45. Harald Rømer Secretary-General Hans-Gert Pöttering President C 207 E/280 EN 14.8.2008 Official Journal of the European Union Tuesday 24 June 2008
